pageContext.claim: “They way they're doing it, they've taken away our rights [during the impeachment inquiry]. So, if they proceed -- and, you know, they'll just get their people. ”
pageContext.analysis: It is grossly misleading to say Trump is unable to call or cross-examine witnesses, or have counsel present, in the House impeachment inquiry. The Constitution says the Senate holds impeachment trials. The House, on the other hand, acts as the prosecutor. The founders thought about it, and that’s how they split their roles.
